alert.note: Alert for Lower Washington County; Southern Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 5:12PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Washington County through 600 PM MDT... At 512 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Virgin River Campground, or 7 miles east of Virgin River Gorge, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... St George, Washington, Santa Clara, Ivins, Bloomington and Snow Canyon State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 1 and 16. Utah Route 18 between mile markers 0 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
